result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael J Hanson

records.addlTxt: DEOJ Agreement
Approving DEOJ

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 9:20 am.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears, pro se.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

PLEA to Ct.1(DC/Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, and a factual basis;

COURT withholds finding and entry of guilt - Court adopts written Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to the Court.
COURT defers matter for a period of 18 months for Defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEOJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND to County DC pursuant to statute 9.21 and pay forfeiture of $100+CC;

DEOJ RH set for 4/12/24 at 10:45 am.
Bond continues.


Adj: 9:29 am.
Re: Order Approving DEOJ

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Hanson
Current: 3104 Ross Ave, Apt.6, Schofield, WI 54476 United States  (Effective: 09-22-2022)
Prior: 2301 Burton Avenue, Kronenwetter, WI 54455
Plea hearing on October 17, 2022 at 09:20 am.
ATTIC DV-VIP Acceptance

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:44 pm 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person, pro se. 
COURT notes waiver of right to counsel in file. 
Deft states wish to accept plea agreement and proceed without counsel. 
COURT directs parties to see JA to set plea hearing. 
Clerk provides deft with plea forms. 
JT is removed. 
Adj: 1:45 pm
State's Notice Regarding Defendant's Statements
State's Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine
Notice of Motion and Motion in Limine
Defendant's Understanding of Prosecutor's Role
Order Granting Request to Withdraw
Re: Order Granting Request to Withdraw as Counsel
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case Called at 8:40 am.
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Brian Williams.
VRCW. 

State notes an offer has been sent but parties have not reached an agreement; 
Attorney Williams would like to keep JT on the calendar. Court informs parties of expectations re: filings and motions for trial. 
Future dates currently set; 

Adj: 8:42 am.
to Modify Bond
AMENDED. Cash continued: No VIOLENT contact with victim(s): J.M.H. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.
Re: Order to amend bond
Stipulation to amend bond
Amended

AMENDED. Cash continued: No VIOLENT contact with victim(s): J.M.H. Police (Kronenwetter PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 8:13 am 
State appears by ADA Rory McGarry; Deft appears in person with Atty Brian Williams. 
Parties have an agreement to modify bond. 
COURT modifies bond to REMOVE family resource requirement and to AMEND no contact with JMH to no VIOLENT contact with JMH. 
Adj: 8:14 am

records.addlTxt: Atty Brian C. Williams

Adjustment Number: 22A 098985,
Payable Number: 276589,
Receipt Number: 22R 003067P,
Amount: $20.00
Bail/bond hearing on June 16, 2022 at 08:10 am.
Letter from J.H. re child exchange
Marathon County Waiver of No Contact Order- (Conditional) JH. Special conditions: Contact via phone call, text message only

Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 10:10 am.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 08:40 am.
Jury status hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:40 pm.
Jury Trial on September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash continued: No contact with victim(s): J.M.H.; Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Police (Kronenwetter PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 3rd party child exchange through the family resource center. No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Clerk: Marisa; Case called: 2:19 pm 
State appears by ADA Jonathan Barnett; Defendant appears in person, pro se. 
Reading Waived. Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA: Not Guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: $150 cash bond continues - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): JMH. 
- Police (Kronenwetter PD) escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- 3rd party child exchange through the family resource center. 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from alcohol. 

BRANCH 3 CASE. 
PTC with JA: 6/1/2022 at 10:10 am. 
FPT: 7/28/2022 at 8:40 am. 
Jury Status Review: 8/30/2022 at 1:40 pm. 
Jury Trial: 9/8/2022 at 9:00 am.
